source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Asteraceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Jeanes, J.A. (1999). Asteraceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Stems and leaves covered with cottony hairs; leaves mostly more than 2 mm wide; pappus scales 4–6, entire, about as long as cypsela; far north-western Victoria

Stems and leaves more or less glabrous, never cottony except sometimes at very base of plant; leaves mostly less than 2 mm wide; pappus scales 10–15, margins fimbriate to plumose, longer than cypsela; western basalt plains
